content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it is really gud

Having the formula for kinetic energy is a bit... uh. It's cool that math-heads can do both but why bother solving for velocity when the formula for potential energy is so much simpler ?
And i say that as a definite non math-head  who had to google how to solve velocity, and had been on a 20 minutes web searching fiesta trying to understand wtf velocity even means when i thought it meant speed, and how can you describe velocity which is supposed to be speed + direction as a number, and how can you get it without knowing stuff like the slope the strength of the skier the friction of the air, and how the fuck do i feel so dumb i should've continued school but i swear all my math teachers were fucking psychos :|

All in all, clash very (too?) easy when you use PE, made me reconsider my life choices when trying to use KE. So that's going to be both an upvote and a downvote for me, and i know from my intense math background (obviously) that +1 -1 =  0, so i won't upvote nor downvote :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear, simple, and fast
bery nais

my solution:
print(round(mass * height * 9.8, 1))

i think its too easy for a clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The clash is decent, although having both formulae when you need only one is pretty confusing, I can see that you can choose the suitable one to improvise when it's a shortest mode clash.

Why even give the equation "Kinetic Energy = 1/2 * mass * velocity squared" when it's not used for anything?

I think this problem should be made more interesting somehow, `print(m * g * h)` is not much of a programming problem.
Good Challenge! I see the "potential"

All sections
* Please standardise the variable names:
  (a)
  • You use [[h]] in Goal and Constraints sections.
  • You use [[height]] in Input section.
  • You use [[heightOfSkiJump]] in stub generator.
  (b)
  • You use [[m]] in Goal and Constraints sections.
  • You use [[mass]] in Input section.
  • You use [[massOfSkier]] in stub generator.

Goal
* Paragraph 1: Please delete the line break after "snow".

* Paragraph 2: Please delete "." after "Given the".

* Equation 1: Please delete "(h)" and "(g)".

* I agree with @25.m: please delete the two hints.

Input
* Please add "<<Line 1>>: An integer" in front of the first line.

* Please add "<<Line 2>>: An integer" in front of the second line.

Output
* Please follow up according to @25.m 's comment regarding rounding and state the requirement here.

Constraints
* Please reduce the upper bound to reflect the cases better (e.g. change 100000 to 100).

Cases
* Each pair of cases (test + validator) should be similar but different. Please revise the cases accordingly.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

One thing to change is to make the decimal points of the expected output consistent, pick between either to 1 d.p. or no rounding at all. If you want the player to round, remember to specify this in the statement.

Other than that I suppose the wording of the statement can also be made more concise. At least for me, the hints with the asterisks at the end didn't quite help in understanding the question.
Thank you for the feedback!
Just fixed! Thank you for the feedback!
hmmmm

Thank you for the comment. Depending on how you solve the problem, you can use m * g * h if you're familiar with physics; however, you can also solve for the velocity and then plug it into the Kinetic energy equation.
Thank you for the comment. It allows the coder to decide which formula to use. How do you think I could spice it up more?
Thank you!
u could include initial velocity, air resistance, maybe a slope too?

Thank you for following up. Below are the issues to fix for the revised version:

Output
* Please change "point" to "place".

Cases
* Test 3 and Validator 4 are the same. Please revise them so that they are different.

Thanks again.
Done!
Do you think I should delete this part so the clash is a bit more challenging ("Since the skier starts from rest, all potential energy at the top converts to kinetic energy at the bottom: PE= KE")
I prefer to keep it, because the sentence makes it clear that "the skier starts from rest".
Thank you!
